Of course people depend on people not to live but to grow both physically and mentally. People depend on people physically because there's always power in numbers. It's difficult to imagine one man building a town or city. People also depend on others mentally to learn from each other's experiences as there's more diversity and a greater chance that something will happen one person that won't happen to others. If man was alone, he would have to do the jobs of those that would be others' if there were any. He might only have time to find food and maintain shelter but have no time for developing and learning to manipulate the things around him. It is because we have the intelligence and ability to communicate and work with others that allowed us to evolve and become what we are. Also, love and tenderness between two is what propelles each of the two onwards. I believe that people need to interact to create a balance that either advances humanity forwards or withers them to nothing.
